column4: Description
column6: Test Steps
column7: Expected Results

column4: Validate all 8 VxRail P570 nodes power on and complete POST
column6: 1. Power on each node; 2. Verify POST completes; 3. Check iDRAC status; 4. Verify all NVMe drives detected
column7: All nodes POST with 16TB NVMe storage detected per node

column4: Validate ESXi 8 installed and operational on each P570 node
column6: 1. Access VxRail Manager; 2. Verify each host status; 3. Check ESXi version; 4. Validate 2TB RAM per node
column7: All 8 ESXi hosts showing online with 16TB total RAM

column4: Validate vSAN disk groups created with all-NVMe storage
column6: 1. Access vCenter vSAN UI; 2. Verify disk groups per host; 3. Check NVMe tier; 4. Verify erasure coding
column7: Each node shows NVMe disk group with FTT=2 policy

column4: Validate vSphere cluster created with all VxRail P570 hosts
column6: 1. Access vCenter; 2. Navigate to cluster; 3. Verify all 8 hosts; 4. Check HA and DRS status
column7: Cluster shows 8 hosts with HA DRS and vSAN enabled

column4: Validate 200TB vSAN datastore available to all hosts
column6: 1. Check vSAN datastore; 2. Verify 200TB capacity; 3. Check mount status; 4. Test write operation
column7: 200TB vSAN datastore accessible from all 8 hosts

column4: Validate NSX-T configured with security policies
column6: 1. Check NSX Manager; 2. Verify distributed firewall; 3. Test microsegmentation rules; 4. Validate logging
column7: NSX-T DFW active with database security zones

column4: Validate Oracle RAC deploys and operates on vSAN
column6: 1. Deploy Oracle RAC VMs; 2. Configure ASM on vSAN; 3. Test RAC failover; 4. Validate witness placement
column7: Oracle RAC operational with sub-ms storage latency

column4: Validate SRM configured with RecoverPoint for VMs
column6: 1. Configure SRM pairing; 2. Create protection groups; 3. Create recovery plans; 4. Verify replication
column7: SRM shows protection groups with RPO <5 min

column4: Description
column6: Test Steps
column7: Expected Results

column4: Validate vSAN cluster achieves 125000+ IOPS performance
column6: 1. Deploy HCIBench appliance; 2. Configure 4K random workload; 3. Run 60-minute test; 4. Record results
column7: vSAN achieves 125000+ IOPS with all-NVMe storage

column4: Validate vSAN read and write latency under 1ms
column6: 1. Configure latency-focused workload; 2. Run 70% read 30% write; 3. Measure average latency; 4. Check 99th percentile
column7: Average latency 0.4ms with 99th percentile under 0.8ms

column4: Validate Oracle database performance on vSAN
column6: 1. Run SLOB benchmark; 2. Measure transaction throughput; 3. Check wait events; 4. Compare to legacy
column7: Oracle achieves 45000 IOPS per database instance

column4: Validate 100GbE network achieves expected throughput
column6: 1. Run iperf3 between hosts; 2. Test vSAN network bandwidth; 3. Measure aggregate throughput; 4. Check packet loss
column7: 100GbE links achieve 95+ Gbps with zero packet loss

column4: Validate HA restarts VMs after simulated host failure
column6: 1. Power off one ESXi host; 2. Monitor VM restart; 3. Measure failover time; 4. Verify accessibility
column7: VMs restart on remaining hosts within 90 seconds

column4: Validate vSAN rebuilds data after dual disk failure
column6: 1. Simulate dual disk failure; 2. Monitor rebuild progress; 3. Verify data integrity; 4. Confirm capacity
column7: vSAN rebuilds data automatically with zero data loss

column4: Validate SRM failover completes within RTO target
column6: 1. Initiate planned failover; 2. Monitor recovery progress; 3. Measure RTO; 4. Validate application access
column7: DR failover completes within 15 minutes RTO target

column4: Validate vSAN encryption at rest with external KMS
column6: 1. Check vSAN encryption status; 2. Verify KMS integration; 3. Test key rotation; 4. Validate audit logging
column7: vSAN encryption operational with external KMS

column4: Validate end-to-end database migration from legacy SAN
column6: 1. Select production database; 2. Initiate Oracle Data Guard; 3. Monitor sync; 4. Perform switchover
column7: Database migrates to vSAN with zero data loss

column4: Validate batch migration of Oracle SQL and SAP HANA
column6: 1. Execute migration runbook; 2. Monitor all databases; 3. Track completion; 4. Verify all operational
column7: All databases migrate successfully within maintenance window

column4: Validate database performance after migration to VxRail
column6: 1. Run production queries; 2. Compare to legacy baseline; 3. Check response times; 4. Validate user experience
column7: Database performance 2.5x better than legacy SAN

column4: Validate DBAs can manage database VMs via vCenter
column6: 1. Log in to vCenter; 2. Access database VM; 3. Modify resources; 4. Take snapshot; 5. Check vSAN policy
column7: All database VM operations complete successfully

column4: Validate VxRail Manager lifecycle management functions
column6: 1. Access VxRail Manager; 2. View cluster health; 3. Check software versions; 4. Review support status
column7: VxRail Manager displays health and enables LCM

column4: Validate complete DR cycle with database recovery
column6: 1. Initiate DR failover; 2. Validate databases online; 3. Run application tests; 4. Execute failback
column7: Complete DR cycle with RPO <5min and RTO <15min
